intro: Octoknema bakossiensis, commonly known as the Bakossi octoknema, is a flowering plant species native to Central Africa. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its small, opposite leaves and yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in moist forest habitats and is often found in understory layers of tropical rainforests. It is not widely cultivated but is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphological features. Despite its ecological significance, it remains relatively understudied in terms of its botanical properties and potential uses.
